tit.e: Yanagimoto-kofun Tumulus Cluster (a Tumulus Cluster in Yanagimoto Town, Tenri City)
tit.cmt: 用語を変更し、補足しました。
tit.e: Yanagimoto-kofun Tumulus Cluster (a Tumulus Cluster in Yanagimoto Town, Tenri City)

sen.j: 柳本古墳群（やなぎもとこふんぐん）は、天理市柳本町に所在する古墳時代前期の古墳群である。
sen.e: Yanagimoto burial mounds are burial mounds of early Kofun period (tumulus period) in Yanagimoto Town, Tenri City.
Yanagimoto-kofun Tumulus Cluster is a tumulus cluster of early Kofun period (tumulus period) in Yanagimoto Town, Tenri City.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Yanagimoto-kofun Tumulus Cluster is a tumulus cluster of early Kofun period (tumulus period) in Yanagimoto Town, Tenri City.

sen.j: 大和古墳群と併せて大和・柳本古墳群とも言われる。
sen.e: It is also called Oyamato-Yanagimoto burial mounds, collectively with Oyamato burial mounds.
sen.cmt: 「大和古墳群」の定訳は"tomb group"となっていますが、他の訳とそろえ"burial mounds"としました。
sen.e: It is also called Oyamato Yanagimoto-kofun Tumulus Cluster, collectively with Oyamato-kofun Tumulus Cluster.
It is also called Oyamato Yanagimoto-kofun Tumulus Cluster, collectively with Oyamato-kofun Tumulus Cluster.

sen.j: その南に纏向古墳群が存在する。
sen.e: To the south are Makimuku burial mounds.
To the south is Makimuku-kofun Tumulus Cluster.
To the south is Makimuku-kofun Tumulus Cluster.

sen.j: 本古墳群は、大和古墳群と谷を隔てて南の丘陵の縁辺に営まれている。
sen.e: These burial mounds are on the peripheral of southern hills across a valley between Oyamato burial mounds.
This cluster is on the peripheral of southern hills across a valley between Oyamato-kofun Tumulus Cluster.
This cluster is on the peripheral of southern hills across a valley between Oyamato-kofun Tumulus Cluster.

sen.j: 2基の巨大古墳とその周囲の中・小形前方後円墳からなっている。
sen.e: It includes two huge tumuluses surrounded by middle and small sized keyhole-shaped mounds.
It includes two huge tumuli surrounded by middle and small sized keyhole-shaped mounds.
It includes two huge tumuli surrounded by middle and small sized keyhole-shaped mounds.

sen.j: まず、行燈山古墳を主墳に大和天神山・アンド山（120メートル）・南アンド山（65メートル）の3古墳が従属している。
sen.e: Andon-yama Tumulus is the main tumulus, with three subordinate tumuluses, Yamato Tenjinyama Tumulus, Andoyama Tumulus (120 m), and Minami Andoyama Tumulus (65 m)
sen.cmt: 「行燈山古墳」の定訳は"kofun (tumulus)"となっていますが、他とそろえ"Tumulus"としました。
sen.e: Andonyama-kofun Tumulus is the main tumulus, with three subordinate tumuli, Yamato Tenjinyama-kofun Tumulus, Andoyama-kofun Tumulus (120 meters), and Minami Andoyama-kofun Tumulus (65 meters).
Andonyama-kofun Tumulus is the main tumulus, with three subordinate tumuli, Yamato Tenjinyama-kofun Tumulus, Andoyama-kofun Tumulus (120 meters), and Minami Andoyama-kofun Tumulus (65 meters).

sen.j: また南に渋谷古墳を主墳に上ノ山（125メートル）・シウロウ塚（120メートル）の二つの古墳群と西の方に柳本大塚（94メートル）などの古墳が点在している。
sen.e: In the south are burial mounds of Shibutani Tumulus as the main tumulus with Uenoyama Tumulus (125 m) and Shiurouzuka Tumulus (120 m), and in the south are tumuluses including Yanagimoto Otsuka Tumulus (94 m).
sen.cmt: 「上ノ山古墳」の定訳は"Mound"が使われていますが、他とそろえ"Tumulus"としました。
sen.e: In the south are Shibutani-kofun Tumulus as the main tumulus with Uenoyama-kofun Tumulus Cluster (125 meters) and Shiurozuka-kofun Tumulus (120 meters), and in the west are tumuli including Yanagimoto Otsuka-kofun Tumulus (94 meters) and so on.

In the south are Shibutani-kofun Tumulus as the main tumulus with Uenoyama-kofun Tumulus Cluster (125 meters) and Shiurozuka-kofun Tumulus (120 meters), and in the west are tumuli including Yanagimoto Otsuka-kofun Tumulus (94 meters) and so on.

sen.j: 大和・柳本古墳群に続く王墓は、奈良盆地の東南の地を離れ、盆地西北部の地に佐紀盾列古墳群（西群）として営まれる。
sen.e: Royal tombs of later period are Sakitatenami Burial Mounds in the northwest of Nara Basin, separately from southeast of the basin.
Mausoleums following Oyamato Yanagimoto-kofun Tumulus Clusters are Sakitatenami-kofun Tumulus Cluster (the west cluster) in the northwest of Nara Basin, separately from southeast of the basin.
Mausoleums following Oyamato Yanagimoto-kofun Tumulus Clusters are Sakitatenami-kofun Tumulus Cluster (the west cluster) in the northwest of Nara Basin, separately from southeast of the basin.

sen.j: 王権が移動したと考えられている。
sen.e: It is thought that the sovereignty moved.
It is thought that the sovereignty moved.
It is thought that the sovereignty moved.
Keyhole-shaped mounds
Keyhole-shaped mounds
Keyhole-shaped mounds
Kurozuka Tumulus/Kurotsuka Tumulus (127.5 m)
Kurozuka-kofun Tumulus (also known as Kurotsuka-kofun Tumulus) (127.5 meters)
Kurozuka-kofun Tumulus (also known as Kurotsuka-kofun Tumulus) (127.5 meters)

sen.j: 行燈山古墳（242メートル、伝崇神天皇陵）
sen.e: Andon-yama Tumulus (242 m, alleged to be imperial mausoleum of Emperor Sujin)
sen.cmt: 「行燈山古墳」の定訳は"kofun (tumulus)"となっていますが、他とそろえ"Tumulus"としました。
sen.e: Andonyama-kofun Tumulus (242 meters, alleged to be the Mausoleum of Emperor Sujin)
Andonyama-kofun Tumulus (242 meters, alleged to be the Mausoleum of Emperor Sujin)

sen.j: 大和天神山古墳（113メートル）
sen.e: Yamato Tenjinyama Tumulus (113 m)
Yamato Tenjinyama-kofun Tumulus (113 meters)
Yamato Tenjinyama-kofun Tumulus (113 meters)

sen.j: 渋谷向山古墳（300メートル、伝景行天皇陵）
sen.e: Shibutani Mukoyama Tumulus (300 m, alleged to be imperial mausoleum of Emperor Keiko)
Shibutani Mukoyama-kofun Tumulus (300 meters, alleged to be the Mausoleum of Emperor Keiko)
Shibutani Mukoyama-kofun Tumulus (300 meters, alleged to be the Mausoleum of Emperor Keiko)
Candy-wrap (keyhole shape with one more handle) shape mound
